children.markdown:
This morning, a select group of bloggers were invited along to a round table discussion with [Tim O’Reilly](http://www.oreillynet.com/pub/au/27), founder of books and conference company [O’Reilly Media](http://oreilly.com/). He, along with conference hosts [Jennifer Pahlka](http://blog.pahlka.com/) of [TechWeb](http://www.techweb.com/home) and [Brady Forrest](http://radar.oreilly.com/brady/) of O’Reilly, fielded questions from the bloggers.

This video captures some of the key reasons why Web 2.0 matters to businesses:

<object height="339" width="450"><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><param name="movie" value="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=2038740&server=vimeo.com&show_title=1&show_byline=1&show_portrait=0&color=ff0179&fullscreen=1"></param><embed allowfullscreen="true" allowscriptaccess="always" height="339" src="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=2038740&server=vimeo.com&show_title=1&show_byline=1&show_portrait=0&color=ff0179&fullscreen=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="450"></embed></object>  
[Web 2.0 & The Enterprise](http://vimeo.com/2038740?pg=embed&sec=2038740) from [Adam Tinworth](http://vimeo.com/adders?pg=embed&sec=2038740) on [Vimeo](http://vimeo.com/?pg=embed&sec=2038740).

Sorry for the typing noises. A large number of people attending the discussion were liveblogging furiously, [myself included](http://www.onemanandhisblog.com/archives/2008/10/web_20_expo_berlin_blogger_rou.html).
